result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Haberli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of probation apply to all counts. Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 9/08/16 at 3:00 pm.
Concurrent with: Cts. 6, 9, 12, 18, 21, 24, 27 & 36.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without consent of victim and Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Civil Judgment Order
Civil Judgment Order
Petition for Civil Judgment for Unpaid Restitution or Court Ordered Financial Obligations
DOC Balance Inquiry sheet.
from St. Croix Correctional Center with amendment to JOC and order - CIP

of conviction and order - CIP.    IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records staff member and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandon J Haberli
Current: 4180 Ploor Rd, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2017)
Prior: 4259 Haberli Rd, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
from Plea & Sentencing Hearing; Sentencing Hearing on Revocation dated 4/10/17

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Defendant Brandon J Haberli in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 10, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
from ADA Korb requesting PRH be moved to 4/10/17 at 11:30 when defendant will be in court on another matter. Court moves hearing.
Probation review hearing on April 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant turned himself into the jail this morning.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court with attorney Peter Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Brandon J Haberli in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Court questions defendant as to the last time he's had contact with is probation agent. Defendant indicates his agent was switched from Jackie Scholten to Cassandra Downing and he hasn't met her yet. Defendant heard there was a warrant out for his arrest so he turned himself in to the jail right away. Court questions defendant on employment/payment of financial obligations. Defendant just finished working for his dad, was now going to apply at Bay Ship. Money he made working for his dad went to pay for living expenses, hasn't made any payments toward his finanacial obligations. Court quashes warrant, sets another probation review hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Cassandra Downing present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposes. Agent Downing/State indicate defendant is an absconder, DOC has issued a warrant for his arrest.  State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Jackie Scholten present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions defendant on how he's doing on probation. Defendant finished his jail sentence 2 months ago, is currently working for his father, is in the process of setting up his assessments so he can get his license back. Agent Scholten advises defendant has one dirty UA and he's missed a few appointment but other than that, he's doing pretty well on probation. State questions why defendant is no longer working at Hatco. Defendant explains his departure from Hatco. Agent Scholten indicates there haven't been any payments toward financial obligations. Court encourages defendant to start making payments toward restitution and financial obligations. State requests court set another probation review hearing. Hearing set.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Restititution summary

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Brandon J Haberli in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 6, 9, 12, 18, 21, 24, 27 & 36 .  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 6, 9, 12, 18, 21, 24, 27 & 36.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Brandon J Haberli in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Brandon J Haberli in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests another status on 1/08/16. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli in court, in custody, with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defendant was fingerprinted 11/24/15.
Door County Jail

No contact direct or indirect with A.H. or his residence.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Brandon J Haberli appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
